meanings.definition: A white, crystalline substance consisting of potassium carbonate, used in baking as a leavening agent.
meanings.sent1: I added a pinch of pearlash to the cake batter to help it rise.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for pearlash to make the bread fluffy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous baker accidentally spilled pearlash all over the kitchen, creating a cloud of white powder.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter floated through the air like pearlash, light and airy.
meanings.sent5: The pearlash transformed the dough into a fluffy masterpiece, ready to be enjoyed.

meanings.sent1: She decided to pearlash the fabric to make it fire-resistant.
meanings.sent2: The old method of pearlashing wood helped preserve it for years.
meanings.sent3: The gardener pearlashed the soil, hoping to improve the growth of the plants.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to pearlash her heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion was pearlashed with a secret ingredient, enhancing its power.
